abstract.text: An object wrapper for primitive scalar numeric values.

inlineContent.text: that offers a value as any C scalar (numeric) type. It defines a set of methods specifically for setting and accessing the value as a signed or unsigned
. (Note that number objects do not necessarily preserve the type they are created with.) It also defines a
method to determine the ordering of two

provides readonly properties that return the object’s stored value converted to a particular Boolean, integer, unsigned integer, or floating point C scalar type. Because numeric types have different storage capabilities, attempting to initialize with a value of one type and access the value of another type may produce an erroneous result—for example, initializing with a
, or initializing with an negative integer value and accessing its
. In some cases, attempting to initialize with a value of a type and access the value of another type may result in loss of precision—for example, initializing with a
value with many significant digits and accessing its
, or initializing with a large integer value and accessing its
object initialized with a value of a particular type accessing the converted value of a different
, will convert its stored value to that converted type in the following ways:
